intro: Schleidenia dasycarpa, commonly known as the rough-fruited Schleidenia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers and related species. The plant is characterized by its erect stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in the spring. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough, hairy texture. Schleidenia dasycarpa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
